meanings.definition: A stone that forms the corner of a building.
meanings.sent1: The perpents of the old castle were weathered and strong.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully placed the perpents to ensure the stability of the structure.
meanings.sent3: The perpents in the wall seemed to gossip about the other stones.
meanings.sent4: The perpents stood tall like guardians at the edge of the building.
meanings.sent5: The perpents jutted out proudly, marking the meeting point of two walls.

meanings.definition: A stone that is used in building to form a vertical face.
meanings.sent1: The perpents were smoothly cut to fit perfectly against each other.
meanings.sent2: The architect selected high-quality perpents for the new skyscraper.
meanings.sent3: The perpents in the construction site played a game of 'who can stand the straightest'.
meanings.sent4: The perpents rose up like a staircase to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The perpents lined up neatly, creating a seamless vertical surface.
